tool.name: CorrelateSoilParamsAndIndices
tool.displayname: Correlate Scaled Terrain Indices with Soil Parameter

param.name: dem
param.dialogReference: A digital elevation model of the area of interest.

param.name: point_shp
param.displayname: Soil Sampling Point Shapefile or Feature Class
param.dialogReference: A point shapefile or feature class containing the values of the soil parameter for correlation with the input terrain indices/surface derivatives

param.name: soil_parameter
param.dialogReference: The soil parameter in the point shapefile/feature class for correlation with terrain indices/surface derivatives.

param.name: terrain_indices
param.displayname: Terrain Indices for Soil Parameter Correlation
param.dialogReference: The surface derivatives/terrain indices to correlate with the soil parameter.

param.name: min_nr
param.dialogReference: The minimum neighborhood radius at which surface derivatives/terrain indices will be derived.

param.name: max_nr
param.dialogReference: The maximum neighborhood radius at which surface derivatives/terrain indices will be derived.

param.name: interval_nr
param.dialogReference: The interval at which surface derivatives/terrain indices will be derived.

param.name: correlation_type
param.dialogReference: Choose PEARSON to perform a Pearson correlation or SPEARMAN to perform a Spearman correlation.

param.name: output_csv
param.displayname: Soil Parameter and Scaled Terrain Indices Correlation Results

param.name: output_png
param.displayname: Output Terrain Indices and Correlation Graph
param.dialogReference: A graph of soil parameter correlation vs terrain indices/surface derivates, similar to Fig. 4 in Evans et al., 2016. Download full text at: http://scholarworks.sfasu.edu/j_of_geospatial_applications_in_natural_resources/vol1/iss1/1/

tool.summary: This tool correlates a soil parameter from an input point feature class/shapefile to terrain indices/surface derivatives derived at various neighborhood radius. It prints to the script tool output the neighborhood radius where the scaled terrain index/surface derivative and soil parameter have maximum correlation. Optional output includes a .csv of correlation results and a graph of soil parameter correlation vs terrain index, similar to Fig. 4 in Evans et al., 2016.
